subject: Art & Design
title: The Eiffel Tower: From Eyesore to Icon
description: Learn The Eiffel Tower: From Eyesore to Icon in one minute.

hook.text: When the Eiffel Tower was built in 1889, Paris intellectuals signed a petition calling it a 'metal asparagus.'

buildup.text: Gustave Eiffel's iron lattice tower was meant to be temporary â€” built for the 1889 World's Fair, then dismantled.

discovery.text: It was saved because of its radio antenna. Practical utility rescued an architectural experiment from demolition.

twist.text: It was the world's tallest structure for 41 years. Today it's the most-visited paid monument on Earth.

climax.text: The tower is repainted every 7 years with 60 tons of paint. Three shades: darkest at the bottom, lightest at the top.

punchline.text: Yesterday's eyesore is today's global icon. Taste evolves.

quiz.question: Why was the Eiffel Tower not demolished after the 1889 World's Fair?
options: Its radio antenna made it practically useful
The demolition would have been too expensive
